report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.08.0]
**INSTITUTION NEUROSURGERY OPERATIVE REPORT PATIENT NAME: **NAME[AAA, BBB M] ACCOUNT #: **ID-NUM **ROOM SURGEON: **NAME[VVV M. WWW], M.D. ASSISTANT(S): ATTENDING PHYSICIAN: **NAME[YYY XXX ZZZ] SURGERY DATE: **DATE[Sep 03 06] ADMISSION DATE: **DATE[Sep 03 2007] DISCHARGE DATE: PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: LEFT TRIGEMINAL NEURALGIA. POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: LEFT TRIGEMINAL NEURALGIA. PROCEDURE: LEFT RETROMASTOID CRANIOTOMY; MICROVASCULAR DECOMPRESSION LEFT FIFTH NERVE; BOVINE DURAPLASTY; TITANIUM PLATE CRANIOPLASTY. STAFF: **NAME[VVV M. WWW], M.D., and Dr. **NAME[ZZZ]. RESIDENT: **NAME[VVV UUU], M.D. ANESTHESIA: General endotracheal anesthesia. COMPLICATIONS: None. SPECIMENS: None. INTRAOPERATIVE MONITORING: Brainstem auditory evoked responses with somatosensory evoked potentials. INDICATIONS FOR OPERATION: The patient is a **AGE[in 60s]-year-old woman with typical trigeminal neuralgia. The patient has opted for microvascular decompression. Options for less invasive therapies including radiosurgery and percutaneous procedures risks were discussed. Consent was given. Risks of stroke, death, failure, hearing loss, facial paralysis, facial numbness, double vision, infection, and spinal fluid leak were discussed. DESCRIPTION OF OPERATION: The patient was identified and brought to the operating room. She was placed under general anesthesia. Her head was put in the Mayfield-Kees headholder, and she was put in the lateral decubitus position with her left side up. All pressures points were padded, and she was taped to the table. Neurophysiological monitoring lines were placed. The left retromastoid region was shaved, prepped, and draped in the usual sterile fashion. A 5-cm linear incision was made just behind the hairline. Self-retaining retractors were placed, and a subperiosteal dissection was carried out. **NAME[TTT SSS] drill was used to perform retromastoid craniotomy such that the edges of the transverse and sigmoid sinuses were exposed. Air cells were waxed, and the wound was copiously irrigated with antibiotic saline. The dura was now opened in a curvilineal fashion and reflected laterally using four Nurolon tack-up sutures. The microscope was brought in. Using microsurgical dissection techniques, the eleventh nerve cistern was identified. The arachnoid was opened and CSF came forth. The cerebellum relaxed well. The arachnoid over the fifth nerve was not dissected free. The petrosal vein was cauterized and divided. The fifth nerve was well visualized. A large vein compressing the fifth nerve was decompressed with Teflon pledgets. A small artery at the reentry zone was also decompressed with Teflon pledgets. Having completed the decompression, we turned our attention to closing. A duraplasty was carried out with bovine pericardium, as the dura could not be closed primarily. The air cells were re-waxed. The wound was copiously irrigated with antibiotic saline. A titanium plate cranioplasty was performed. The muscle and fascial layers were closed with interrupted inverted 2-0 and 3-0 Vicryl suture, the skin was closed with running 4-0 Ethilon stitch. Sterile dressings were applied. The patient was ultimately removed from the Mayfield-Kees headholder, extubated, and transferred to the recovery room in stable condition. ATTESTATION STATEMENT: Please note Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] and **NAME[M] were present and scrubbed for this procedure and performed the entire procedure with the assistance of Dr. **NAME[UUU]. ______________________________________ **NAME[VVV M. WWW], M.D.
Dictator: **NAME[VVV M. WWW], M.D. **INITIALS D: **DATE[Sep 03 2007] 17:36:50 T: **DATE[Sep 04 2007] 10:42:43 R: **DATE[Sep 04 2007] 10:42:43/rk Job ID: 331031/**ID-NUM Cc:
*** Dictated By: -**NAME[WWW, RRR M]. *** Electronically Signed by **NAME[VVV WWW] **DATE[Sep 10 2007] 05:36:56 PM
